sections.heading: Definitions.
Application for testing site permit; evaluation; notice of public hearing.
Application for testing site permit; public hearing; decision.
Testing site permit; effect.
Expiration of testing site permits.
sections.text:
Upon the expiration of the term of a testing site permit or any renewal thereof:

A. all activities within the area of the sustainable development testing site shall comply with all applicable laws, ordinances or rules, including permitting requirements; and

B. the permittee may provide the wastewater treatment and disposal technologies to the wastewater technical advisory committee for review and, if appropriate, for listing by the department of environment as approved for use.

History:Laws 2007, ch. 34, § 6.

Effective dates.— Laws 2007, ch. 34, § 9 makes the act effective July 1, 2007.

sections.heading: Sale of land within a sustainable development testing site.
sections.text:
Land within a sustainable development testing site shall not be sold in whole or in part unless:

A. the subsequent owner obtains a testing site permit pursuant to the provisions of the Sustainable Development Testing Site Act; or

B. the owner or subsequent owner enters into an agreement with the planning commission to bring the land and improvements within the sustainable development testing site into compliance with all county codes, ordinances, rules or permits that would be applicable to the site in the absence of a testing site permit.

History:Laws 2007, ch. 34, § 7.

Effective dates.— Laws 2007, ch. 34, § 9 makes the act effective July 1, 2007.

sections.heading: Promulgation of rules.
sections.text:
A county or planning commission may define a new category of rules applicable to sustainable development testing sites and promulgate rules for the category. A county or a planning commission may also promulgate rules or permit conditions applicable to a specific sustainable development testing site.

History:Laws 2007, ch. 34, § 8.

Effective dates.— Laws 2007, ch. 34, § 9 makes the act effective July 1, 2007.
